plan:
If I bid higher than my value, I can win if the other bidders bid lower amounts. However, I risk losing if I win the auction, as I will have to pay more than the prize's worth. There could be possible regrets here due to potential financial losses instead of profits.

If I bid equal to my value, I can win if the other bids are lower. In this case, I have little to lose, but I may not gain much either. The potential regret here is not maximizing profit.

If I bid lower than my value, I can still win if the other bids are lower than mine. I may lose if others bid higher, but there's minimal risk of financial loss. A potential regret here is missing out on a profit if I could've bid higher.

My final bid would be a moderate strategy, slightly lower than my value, minimizing loss risk while maintaining the possibility of profit.

If my bid is higher than my value, I would win when both my opponents bid lower than my bid, but I would lose money equivalent to the larger bid of both opponents subtracted from my value. In such instances, my bid might lead to regret due to potential financial loss.

If my bid is equal to my value, I win when the other bidders' bids fall below my value, and lose when anyone bids higher. I may regret placing such a bid if others consistently bid higher.

If my bid is lower than my value, I win when both opponents bid lower than my value, but lose if anyone bids higher. However, I might regret this strategy if I could have won by bidding slightly higher.

My final bid for this round is 60 Euro.

If my bid is higher than my value, I win when the bids from Andy and Betty are lower than my bid. However, I lose when their bids exceed my value as I would have to pay more than it's worth. Hence, I might regret it as this does not maximize my profit.

When my bid is equal to my value, I win if my opponents' bids are lower, but lose to higher bids. I won't regret my bid since the outcome is fair depending on the competition.

If my bid is lower than my value, I win when Andy and Betty bid below mine. I lose when any bid tops mine - no regrets because I’m only willing to pay up to my bid while protecting my profit.

For the final bid, I’ll consider bidding the average of my value and the previous winning bid. This balances risk between overbidding and losing out on the value.

My plan is to test a riskier approach by bidding slightly above my value if it's low, to push competitors' payments. If my value is high, I'll bid slightly below, to maximize potential profit while avoiding overpaying. I'll adjust based on opponents' responses.

Given the past result, I plan to adjust my bidding strategy to be more conservative and closer to my value. I'll bid slightly higher if my value is high and slightly lower if my value is low. I'll monitor opponents' bid patterns to inform my future bids.

I plan to continue a cautious strategy, bidding low to avoid potential losses. However, I'll slightly increase my bid this round for data-gathering purposes, to observe if a higher bid affects the other two bidders' actions. I'll bid exactly half of the previous round's winning bid, 30 Euros.

I plan to moderately bid below my value while observing opponent's strategies. This balance will allow scope for profit while reducing loss risk. Lower bids will also gauge competitors' maximum limit, useful for future strategies.

My next plan is to observe others' bidding patterns to calibrate my bid choice. If my value is high, I plan to bid my exact value. If my value is relatively low, I will cut it by 10%, enabling some profit if I win.

In the upcoming round, I plan to bid midway between my value and the previous round's winning bid, aiming to test the effects this strategy has on my winnings while balancing with preserving my profit margin.
I will vary between bidding at my value and slightly below it, allowing me to gather more data on opponents' behaviors while minimizing potential losses and maximizing profits when possible.

My plan for the next rounds is to test a strategy where I adjust my bids based on the average difference between bid and value observed in previous rounds, while still staying within my value limit. If the value is high, I'll bid closer to it.

For the upcoming rounds, I'll implement an adaptive bidding strategy. I'll increase my bid by 5 Euros each time I win, and decrease by 5 Euros each time I lose. This increment/decrement approach will let me determine the most profitable impact zone for bidding.

Moving forward, I plan to adjust my bidding strategy based on my opponents' behaviour and my value. If my value is high, I'll bid around that value. If it's low, I'll take a riskier approach by bidding higher. I'll continuously adapt based on results.

I plan to adopt a mid-risk strategy, bidding closer to my value but still leaving some margin. I'll also take note of the trends in my opponents' bidding patterns to adjust my bids accordingly for maximizing profits.

I will adopt a strong aggressive strategy by increasing bids by 20 Euros when I win, while maintaining a moderation strategy by decreasing bids by 5 Euros when I lose to balance the risks and rewards.

I plan to implement an aggressive strategy for high values, bidding slightly above my own value. For low values, I'll keep my bid just below the value to avoid losses, continuously adjusting based on opponent behaviour.

Based on previous rounds' analysis, I will implement an adaptive strategy. If my value is high (>50 Euro), I will bid close to my value. If it's moderate (25-50 Euro), I'll bid 80% of my value, for low values (<25 Euro), I'll bid half. Adjustments will be made observing opponents' trends.

I plan to apply dynamic bidding by adding 15 Euros when winning and subtracting 5 Euros when losing to perpetuate profit momentum; also, this will evoke competitor actions, thus aiding strategical adaptation.
Continue to bid slightly below my value. Experiment with a riskier approach, bidding above my value when it's low. Adjust strategies according to behaviors of bid opponents and profit trends.

My strategy will experiment with slightly riskier bids. I'll bid closer to my value when it's high, while remaining conservative for low values. I'll continue to observe opponents and adjust accordingly.

For the next round, I'll modify my winning bid strategy to add 10 Euros, not 15. As I've learned, lower winning bids can yield higher profits. Meanwhile, I'll continue reducing my bid by 5 Euros when losing, to limit potential losses.

My plan includes analyzing past strategies and outcomes, focusing on profitable trends. I'll experiment with risky bidding for low values and conservative bids for high values. Adjustments will depend on opponents' behaviour and market conditions to optimize profits. Balance is key: mitigate losses and capitalize on potential gains.

Based on past trends, I plan to divide my future bidding strategy in three categories: If my value is high (>60 Euro), I'll bid 5% below value. For moderate values (30-60 Euro), I'll bid 70% of value, and for low values (<30 Euro), I'll bid half my value.

Given the context, I plan to test a more aggressive bidding strategy, bidding closer to or equal to my value while maintaining a safe distance from previous highest bids, and evaluating the data after each round to refine bidding methods.

I will continue bidding just below my value, but for low values, I will shift to a moderately riskier strategy, bidding slightly above value. The focus will be to observe and adapt to opponents' patterns while optimizing profits.

For the upcoming rounds, I plan to test a cautious but profit-oriented approach: if my value crosses the 70 Euro mark, I will bid my value minus 4 Euro, for moderate values (40-70 Euro) I'll bid 85% of my value, and for low values (<40 Euro), I'll bid 50% my value.

I'll continue bidding closer to my value but lower than previous highest bids. If I lose two rounds consecutively, I'll decrease my bid by 10 Euros. If I win, add 10 Euros to my next bid. Monitoring and adjusting based on competitors' actions is crucial.

My next strategy involves bidding exactly at my value for higher values and taking calculated risks by bidding above my value for lower ones. I will closely analyze the range of opponents' bids, adjusting my strategy accordingly to maximize long-term profits.

Next, I'll continue testing a cautious approach, tailoring my bid to my value. If my value exceeds 70 Euro, I'll bid 95% of it. For values from 40 to 70 Euro, I bid around 85%. And for values below 40 Euro, I bid 65% of it.

In the upcoming rounds, I plan to bid slightly below my value, exactly 10 Euros less. In case of consecutive losses, I'll further reduce my bid by 5 Euros each time. If I win, I'll increase my next bid by 5 Euros.

Going forward, I'll diversify my strategies based on my value and opponents' tendencies. For low values, I'll opt for bidding slightly above, acknowledging the risk of losses. For high values, I'll maintain bids close to but below value, prioritizing profit maximization over the mere act of winning.

My next strategy involves risk-based bidding: if my value is above 70 Euro, I'll bid 98% of it. For values between 40-70 Euro, I'll bid 90% and for values below 40 Euro, I'll bid 75%. I'll tweak this contingent on opponents' bidding trends.

Having learned from past rounds, my next strategy involves gradually increasing my bids, particularly when my value is high. I'll bid up by 10 Euros each win, and down by 5 Euros each loss. This approach balances risk and reward while adapting to competitors' behaviors.

Moving forward, I will continue bidding just below my value for higher values. For lower values, I'll experiment with risky measures by bidding slightly above my value, aiming to prompt higher counter-bids from competitors, while constantly monitoring and adapting to opponents' responses.
I plan to implement a proportional bidding strategy based on my value: bid 98% of high values (>70), 90% of moderate values (40-70), and 75% for low values (<40), adjusting for opponents' patterns.

In the upcoming rounds, I intend to adopt a dynamic bidding strategy. If I win, I'll increase my bid by 10% of my value. For losses, I'll bid 5% less than my value to optimize earning potential. This approach encompasses both risky and conservative methods.

I will implement an adaptive strategy: for lower values, I'll bid slightly above to potentially raise opponents' payments; for higher values, I'll bid just below to maximize profit and avoid overpaying. I'll continuously assess and adjust based on opponents' behaviours and past round outcomes.

Plan: Test aggressive bidding- bid directly equal to value for high values; 95% of value for moderate, and 85% for low. Monitor opponent patterns, adjust if necessary to mitigate risk and enhance profit.

Given the results from previous rounds, the next strategy to test will involve bidding my value when it falls below a threshold, say 30, while for higher values, I'll bid an average of my value and the last winning bid to balance profits with competitive presence.

My next plan is to apply a dynamic strategy: bid slightly higher than my value during low-value rounds to stimulate competition, and slightly less during high-value rounds to mitigate risk, while continually observing and adapting based on opponents' trends.

Depending on my value, I'll be more aggressive: for high values (>70 Euros) I'll bid equal to my value, for moderate values (40-70 Euros) I'll bid 95% of value, and for low values (<40 Euros) I'll bid 85%.

For future rounds, I'm planning to implement a rotating strategy, alternating between bidding 70% and 80% of my value, to compare these percentages' effectiveness while maintaining a significant profit margin. I will also consider previous winning bid amounts in refining my strategy.

In the subsequent rounds, I will implement an adaptive strategy targeting incremental gains. For higher values, my bid shall be slightly below the value ensuring potential profits. Meanwhile, for lower values, I will occasionally bid higher than my value, inciting competitive bidding while monitoring overall profitability.

Considering the earlier rounds, I will continue aggressive bidding, selecting a bid at my actual value for high value, 97% of value for moderate and 90% for low value. Observations and adjustments based on opponent's strategies will be made.

In subsequent rounds, I'll experiment with adjusting bids as a percentage of my value (70% to 80%) while also considering the value of previous winning bids. This way, I can refine my bids for both high and low stake scenarios.
